segmentData.description: The foundational AI on which further training and customizations are built.
segmentData.valueDescription: Doowii is a third-party sub-processor for Intelligent Insights. Doowii's tools use OpenAI GPT-4o, GPT-3.5 Turbo, and Claude Sonnet 3.5

segmentData.description: Indicates the AI model has been given customer data in order to improve its results.
Indicates which training or operational content was given to the model.
segmentData.valueDescription: Doowii is trained on the Canvas LMS database schema, and receives no data from Canvas. The user's prompt and heuristics (such as summary statistics) are shared with the model to generate a response.

segmentData.description: How long the model stores customer data.
segmentData.valueDescription: Data is retained through the life of your contract with Instructure.

segmentData.description: Recording the AI's performance for auditing, analysis, and improvement.
segmentData.valueHint: Logs data / Does not log data

segmentData.description: The locations where the AI model is officially available and supported.
Sensitive data that can be used to identify an individual.
segmentData.valueDescription: Prompt, summary statistics.

segmentData.description: The ability to turn the AI on or off within the product.
Indicates if a human is involved in the AI's process or output.
segmentData.valueDescription: Ask your data returns a methodology description along with a generated query. Users have the ability to edit the generated SQL directly.

segmentData.description: Preventative safety mechanisms or limitations built into the AI model.
segmentData.valueDescription: Questions are scoped to the domain only, highly ambiguous terms ask for clarification.

segmentData.description: Any risks the model may pose to the user.
segmentData.valueDescription: Incorrect interpretation of the question. Inaccurate SQL may be generated. Suggested questions or methodologies may not be relevant.

segmentData.description: The specific results the AI model is meant to achieve.
segmentData.valueDescription: Provide accurate data retrieval and analysis through natural language prompting.

nutritionFacts.description: AI-powered query tool enables users to ask natural language questions and receive textual or visual responses with detailed explanations of the methodology.
nutritionFacts.name: Ask Your Data

segmentData.description: The foundational AI on which further training and customizations are built.

segmentData.description: The locations where the AI model is officially available and supported.
Sensitive data that can be used to identify an individual.
segmentData.valueDescription: No PII is intentionally sent to the model. If there is incidental PII in any of the shared data, such as in the submission body, it will be sent to the model.

segmentData.description: The ability to turn the AI on or off within the product.
Indicates if a human is involved in the AI's process or output.
segmentData.valueDescription: Grade suggestion is displayed and selected by default, but the instructor much make the final decision to edit or accept the suggestions.

segmentData.description: Preventative safety mechanisms or limitations built into the AI model.
segmentData.valueDescription: The Claude Sonnet model has inherent guardrails built in.

segmentData.description: Any risks the model may pose to the user.
segmentData.valueDescription: Model may work better with certain kinds of assignment types or disciplines. The grader must remain alert to incorrect assumptions from the model.

segmentData.description: The specific results the AI model is meant to achieve.
segmentData.valueDescription: Reduced bias in grading, fairness, and consistency. Grading efficiency, saving teachers time.

nutritionFacts.description: AI powered automatic grading and feedback suggestions to enable more consistent, fair, and efficient grading workflows.
nutritionFacts.name: Grading Assistance

segmentData.description: The foundational AI on which further training and customizations are built.
segmentData.valueDescription: Anthropic Claude models are provided via Amazon Bedrock Foundation Models (FMs).

segmentData.description: Indicates the AI model has been given customer data in order to improve its results.
Indicates which training or operational content was given to the model.
segmentData.valueDescription: Discussion topic, prompt, and student replies are used.

segmentData.description: How long the model stores customer data.
segmentData.valueDescription: No user data is stored or reused by the model.

segmentData.description: Recording the AI's performance for auditing, analysis, and improvement.
segmentData.valueDescription: Model evaluations and reply labels are logged for debugging and troubleshooting purposes.
segmentData.valueHint: Logs data / Does not log data

segmentData.description: The locations where the AI model is officially available and supported.
Sensitive data that can be used to identify an individual.
segmentData.valueDescription: Known PII is masked before being sent to the model, though any PII present in the discussion reply is not and may be shared with the model.

segmentData.description: The ability to turn the AI on or off within the product.
Indicates if a human is involved in the AI's process or output.
segmentData.valueDescription: Instructors may review AI-generated evaluations or review posts directly.

segmentData.description: Preventative safety mechanisms or limitations built into the AI model.
segmentData.valueDescription: Model responses are logged for quality assurance, and responses with low confidence are flagged "Needs Review" to encourage human intervention.

segmentData.description: Any risks the model may pose to the user.
segmentData.valueDescription: The model may misclassify some nuanced replies.

segmentData.description: The specific results the AI model is meant to achieve.
segmentData.valueDescription: Instructors are able to quickly assess the quality of student replies, identify low-effort or off-topic contributions, and focus their attention to where it is needed most.

nutritionFacts.description: Discussion Insights uses AI to evaluate student discussion replies, highlight relevant contributions, and flag those that may need instructor review.
nutritionFacts.name: Discussion Insights

segmentData.description: The foundational AI on which further training and customizations are built.

segmentData.description: Indicates the AI model has been given customer data in order to improve its results.
Indicates which training or operational content was given to the model.
segmentData.valueDescription: The model uses chat transcripts and information requested from the Canvas API to execute its actions.

segmentData.description: How long the model stores customer data.
segmentData.valueDescription: Chat logs are retained indefinitely for troubleshooting and debugging.

segmentData.description: Recording the AI's performance for auditing, analysis, and improvement.
segmentData.valueDescription: Chat logs are retained for troubleshooting and debugging purposes.
segmentData.valueHint: Logs data / Does not log data

segmentData.description: The locations where the AI model is officially available and supported.
Sensitive data that can be used to identify an individual.
segmentData.valueDescription: If requested during the the chat, user, course, and student identifiers or metadata may be shared with the model.

segmentData.description: The ability to turn the AI on or off within the product.
Indicates if a human is involved in the AI's process or output.
segmentData.valueDescription: The agent only takes action based on human requests, and all write actions must be confirmed by the user.

segmentData.description: Preventative safety mechanisms or limitations built into the AI model.
segmentData.valueDescription: Access to the agent is limited to users with an Admin- or Teacher-based role. Data access and functions are scoped to the permissions available to the chat user.

segmentData.description: Any risks the model may pose to the user.
segmentData.valueDescription: The model may misinterpret user requests and require additional prompting.

segmentData.description: The specific results the AI model is meant to achieve.
segmentData.valueDescription: Users are able to save time by relying on the Agent to execute complex workflows, batch actions, and other time-consuming Canvas tasks.

nutritionFacts.description: Ignite Agent is a faculty chat assistant capable of translating natural language requests into complex Canvas workflows.
nutritionFacts.name: Agent
